initialOrderOverride._note: All at-start Complex Defense orders are replaced by Move orders (SM special rule)

rules._flukeNote: 9 Corps cavalry units may NOT fulfill reserve requirement for Fluke Stoppage (SM rule)

movementCosts._source: SM_Rules.pdf — SM Special Terrain Effects on Movement chart

_notes.P: Prohibited — unit type may not enter or cross
_notes.ot: Cost equals other terrain in hex (road/pike/trail overlays)
_notes.0.5: Half the unit's full movement allowance (round up)
_notes.additive: Hexside/elevation costs are ADDED to terrain cost

pike._note: Pike = National Road. 'ot' for line formation = cost of other terrain in hex.

road._note: Road: add +0.5 MP per Slope hexside when using road movement only (see roadSlopePenalty)

hexsideCosts._note: These are ADDITIONAL costs added to the terrain cost when crossing the hexside

verticalSlope._note: SM Special: 50-ft contour interval — Vertical slopes are IMPASSABLE to all units

roadSlopePenalty._note: When moving along a Road (not Pike or Trail), add this cost per slope hexside crossed

victoryPoints._note: VP formula: Union VP minus Confederate VP = net result. Positive = Union advantage.

wreck._note: VPs awarded to the OPPONENT for wrecking formations or eliminating artillery.

confederate._note: Union earns these VPs by wrecking Confederate units

union._note: Confederate earns these VPs by wrecking Union units

victoryConditions._note: Result = Union VP total minus Confederate VP total.

randomEvents._note: Roll 2d6 at the start of the Confederate or Union player turn (as applicable). Special re-roll triggers noted per table.

table.text: Roll on Leader Loss Table for D.H. Hill. If Killed, remove from play. If Wounded, place on division HQ, must remain with HQ for remainder of game, but may continue to issue orders at initiative rating 3. Ignore if Hill is already Wounded.
D.H. Hill may not attempt Initiative for next 2 turns. Ignore if currently under this restriction.
Select one Confederate Brigade at random. Immediately make a Morale Check for each unit in that Brigade using all applicable modifiers. Execute results normally.
Union player freely picks any one Confederate combat unit and marks it Low Ammo. Cannot reduce a unit to No Ammo status.

Next scheduled Confederate reinforcement group is delayed 2 turns. Variable reinforcements are unaffected unless they have already been scheduled. If Force A and Force B are scheduled for the same turn, select one at random.

Freely select any one Confederate Brigade scheduled as a reinforcement and advance its arrival by 4 turns. If the new time is the current turn or earlier, the Brigade arrives this turn. Ignore Force A/B unless already scheduled.

During the Fire Combat Phase of the current turn, the Confederate player may apply all Flank fire modifiers to any one Fire Combat involving Small Arms fire. Include all Flank modifiers on any resulting Straggler/Morale Checks.

Union player freely chooses one Confederate infantry or dismounted cavalry unit within 3 hexes of a Union infantry or dismounted cavalry unit. Immediately resolve Fire Combat against it using the 4–6 column on the Fire Combat Table (no other modifiers). Ignore Low Ammo markings; apply Flank modifier to any Straggler/Morale Checks.

Freely choose any three Confederate Brigades, then randomly select one of those three. All units of the selected Brigade ignore all unfavorable Morale results during the current Confederate player turn.
Select one Confederate Brigade at random. That Brigade may not move or fire during the current Confederate player turn.
D.H. Hill may not attempt Initiative for next 2 turns. Ignore if currently under this restriction.

Select one Union Corps leader at random and roll on the Leader Loss Table. If Killed, remove from play. If Wounded, place on Corps HQ (must remain there for remainder of game) and reduce leader rating by -1. Ignore if any Corps leader is already Wounded or Killed.
McClellan may not issue orders for the next 4 turns. Ignore if currently under this restriction or if McClellan has not yet arrived on the map.
Select one Union Brigade at random. That Brigade may not move or fire during the current Union player turn.
Confederate player freely picks any one Union combat unit and marks it Low Ammo. Cannot reduce a unit to No Ammo status.
The next scheduled Union reinforcement group is delayed 2 turns.
Randomly select one order currently in Delay status. Roll again on the Order Acceptance Table using the same values as the original order. Apply the new result normally.
All units of Gibbon's Brigade (4/1/1) may ignore all unfavorable Morale results during the current Union player turn.

Confederate player freely chooses one Union infantry or dismounted cavalry unit within 3 hexes of a Confederate infantry or dismounted cavalry unit. Immediately resolve Fire Combat against it using the 4–6 column on the Fire Combat Table (no other modifiers). Apply Flank modifier to any Straggler/Morale Checks.

Select one Union Division at random. If that Division is currently acting on an attack order (by itself or as part of a Corps order), treat it as having failed a Stoppage Check and apply the effects immediately. New orders or Initiative are required to resume. Ignore if the selected Division (or its Corps) does not have a currently Accepted order.
Union Corps leaders may not attempt Initiative for the next 2 turns.
